class_notes: You must have permission to enroll in-person.
course_description: This course exposes students to philosophical and ethical dimensions of human-nature relationships. Students will consider their own views toward nature. Philosophical and ethical concepts are examined through readings, discussions, and group activities. Fulfills an ENVS Elective requirement.
prerequisites: This course requires ENVS 131 or ENVS_OX 131 or  BIOL_OX 111 or equivalent transfer credit as a prerequisite OR permission of instructor.
schedule_location: MW 9:40am-10:55am in Math & Science Center - N304
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 2845, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 9:40-10:55a, Instructor: J. Wegner, Status: Closed
